 778+ C9AD 37           PL44TooBig:             scf
 779+ C9AE C9                                   ret
 780+ C9AF              Project:
 781+ C9AF 2A 0C C0     PROJ:                   ld      hl,(UBnKxlo)                    ; Project K+INWK(x,y)/z to K3,K4 for center to screen
 782+ C9B2 22 E3 9C                             ld      (varP),hl
 783+ C9B5 3A 0E C0                             ld      a,(UBnKxsgn)
 784+ C9B8 CD 8C C9                             call    PLS6                            ; returns result in K (0 1) (unsigned) and K (3) = sign note to no longer does 2's C
 785+ C9BB D8                                   ret     c                               ; carry means don't print
 786+ C9BC 2A F8 9D                             ld      hl,(varK)                       ; hl = k (0 1)
 787+ C9BF                                      ; Now the question is as hl is the fractional part, should this be multiplied by 127 to get the actual range
 788+ C9BF 3E 80                                ld      a,ViewCenterX
 789+ C9C1 ED 31                                add     hl,a                            ; add unsigned a to the 2's C HL to get pixel position
 790+ C9C3 22 0B 9E                             ld      (varK3),hl                      ; K3 = X position on screen
 791+ C9C6 2A 0F C0     ProjectY:               ld      hl,(UBnKylo)
 792+ C9C9 22 E3 9C                             ld      (varP),hl
 793+ C9CC 3A 11 C0                             ld      a,(UBnKysgn)
 794+ C9CF CD 8C C9                             call    PLS6
 795+ C9D2 D8                                   ret     c
 796+ C9D3 2A F8 9D                             ld      hl,(varK)                       ; hl = k (0 1)
 797+ C9D6 3E 40                                ld      a,ViewCenterY
 798+ C9D8 ED 31                                add     hl,a                            ; add unsigned a to the 2's C HL to get pixel position
 799+ C9DA 22 11 9E                             ld      (varK4),hl                      ; K3 = X position on screen
 800+ C9DD C9                                   ret

  10++C9DE              	ReturnOnMemBitClear UBnKexplDsp,3       ; bit 3 denotes that there is nothing to erase as its already done

  10++C9E1 CB 5F       >                        bit 	3,a
  10++C9E3 C8          >                        ret		z

  56++CA2F FE 00                                cp      0

  58++CA33              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  59++CA33 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen

 111++CA7D              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 112++CA7D              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 113++CA7D              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 113++CA7D B7          >                        or a
 114++CA7E E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 115++CA80 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 116++CA81 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 117++CA83                                     ; pop     de                          ; we need de back
 118++CA83 22 EC C9                             ld      (clipDx),hl

 120++CA87 32 EE C9                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a

 130++CA8E ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 131++CA90 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 132++CA92 22 EF C9                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 133++CA95 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 134++CA96                                     ; ld      a,ixl
 135++CA96                                     ; sbc     c
 136++CA96                                     ; ld      (clipDy),a
 137++CA96                                     ; ld      a,ixh
 138++CA96                                     ; sbc     a,b
 139++CA96                                     ; ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 140++CA96                                     ; pop     hl
 141++CA96
 142++CA96              ;So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 143++CA96                                    ;  push    hl                          ; Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs
 144++CA96 21 ED C9                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh

 146++CA9A 32 E7 9D                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now

 148++CAA0 3A F0 C9     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 149++CAA3 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 150++CAA6 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 151++CAA8 2A EF C9                             ld      hl,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 152++CAAB                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 152++CAAB AF          >					xor 	a
 152++CAAC 93          >                    sub 	e
 152++CAAD 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 152++CAAE 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a

 152++CAB0 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 153++CAB1 22 EF C9                             ld      (clipDy),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 154++CAB4 2A EC C9     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 155++CAB7 3A ED C9                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 156++CABA ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 157++CABD 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 158++CABF                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 159++CABF                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 159++CABF AF          >					xor 	a
 159++CAC0 95          >					sub 	l
 159++CAC1 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 159++CAC2 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 159++CAC3 94          >					sub 	h
 159++CAC4 67          >					ld 		h,a
 160++CAC5                                     ; ld      (clipDx),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out; we still retain the old sign in NonABS version
 161++CAC5              .LL111:               ;  push    de
 162++CAC5                                     ; ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 163++CAC5                                     ; ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 164++CAC5 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 165++CAC6 B2                                   or      d
 166++CAC7 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 166++CAC9
 167++CAC9                                      ShiftDERight1
 167++CAC9 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 167++CACB CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 168++CACD                                      ShiftHLRight1
 168++CACD CB 3C       >			   srl h
 168++CACF CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 169++CAD1 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 170++CAD3              .CalculateDelta:        ;ld      (clipDx),hl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 171++CAD3                                      ;ld      (clipDy),de                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 172++CAD3              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 173++CAD3 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 174++CAD4 32 01 9E                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 175++CAD7 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 176++CAD8                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 176++CAD8 BB          >                        cp      e
 176++CAD9 DA E9 CA    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 177++CADC              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 178++CADC 32 E5 9D     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 179++CADF 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 180++CAE0 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 181++CAE1 CD B7 B0                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 182++CAE4 32 E6 9D                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 183++CAE7 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 184++CAE9              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 185++CAE9 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 186++CAEA 57                                   ld      d,a
 187++CAEB 32 E5 9D                             ld      (varQ),a
 188++CAEE 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 189++CAEF CD B7 B0                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 190++CAF2 32 E6 9D                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 191++CAF5 21 01 9E                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 192++CAF8 35                                   dec     (hl)
 193++CAF9 D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 194++CAFA E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 195++CAFB 3A E6 9D                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 196++CAFE 32 F1 C9                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 197++CB01 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 198++CB03                                      ;       push    af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 199++CB03                                      ;       ld      a,iyl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 200++CB03                                      ;       ld      (varXX12p2),a        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 201++CB03                                      ;       pop     af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 202++CB03 3A E7 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 203++CB06 32 F2 C9                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 204++CB09                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 205++CB09 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 206++CB0B FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 207++CB0D 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 208++CB0F ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 209++CB12 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 210++CB14              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 211++CB14 CD 3B CB     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 212++CB17 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 213++CB19 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 214++CB1C 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 215++CB1E              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 216++CB1E 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 217++CB1F B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 218++CB20 C2 46 CA                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 219++CB23 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 220++CB24 FA 46 CA                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 221++CB27              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 222++CB27              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 223++CB27 EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 224++CB28 DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 225++CB2A C5                                   push    bc
 226++CB2B DD E1                                pop     ix
 227++CB2D C1                                   pop     bc
 228++CB2E CD 3B CB                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 229++CB31 3A F5 C9                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 230++CB34 3D                                   dec     a
 231++CB35 32 F5 C9                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 232++CB38 C3 33 CA     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 233++CB3B
 234++CB3B              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 235++CB3B              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 236++CB3B 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 237++CB3C ED 27 80                             test    $80
 238++CB3F 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 239++CB41 32 E7 9D     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 240++CB44 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 241++CB47 CD BD CB                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 242++CB4A                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 243++CB4A                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 244++CB4A C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 245++CB4D 2A F6 C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 246++CB50              ;                        ex      hl,de
 247++CB50                                  ;    ld      hl,bc
 248++CB50 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 249++CB51 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 250++CB53 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 251++CB56               ;                       pop     de
 252++CB56 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 253++CB58 FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 254++CB5A 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 255++CB5C 3D                                   dec     a
 256++CB5D 32 E7 9D                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 257++CB60 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 258++CB63 CD BD CB                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 259++CB66                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 260++CB66                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 261++CB66 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 262++CB69                                    ;  push    de                          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 263++CB69 2A F6 C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 264++CB6C                                    ; ex      de,hl                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 265++CB6C 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 266++CB6D 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 267++CB6F                                    ; ex      hl,de                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 268++CB6F                                    ; ld      hl,bc                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 269++CB6F                                    ; add     hl,de                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 270++CB6F 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 271++CB72                                    ;  pop     de
 272++CB72              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 273++CB72 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 274++CB73 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 275++CB76 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 276++CB78 32 E7 9D                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 277++CB7B 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 278++CB7C 32 E6 9D                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 279++CB7F E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 280++CB82 CD E4 CB                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 281++CB85                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 282++CB85                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 283++CB85 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 284++CB88 D5                                   push    de
 285++CB89 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 286++CB8A 2A F6 C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 287++CB8D 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 288++CB8E D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 289++CB8F 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 290++CB92 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 291++CB93 E6 80                                and     $80
 292++CB95 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 293++CB96 C8                                   ret     z
 294++CB97 E5                                   push    hl
 295++CB98 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 296++CB9A 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 297++CB9D B7                                   or      a
 298++CB9E ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 299++CBA0 22 E6 9D                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 300++CBA3 7C                                   ld      a,h
 301++CBA4 E1                                   pop     hl
 302++CBA5 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 303++CBA8 C0                                   ret     nz
 304++CBA9              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 305++CBA9 E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 306++CBAC CD E4 CB                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 307++CBAF                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 308++CBAF                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 309++CBAF C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 310++CBB2 D5                                   push    de
 311++CBB3 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 312++CBB4 2A F6 C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 313++CBB7 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 314++CBB8 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 315++CBBB D1                                   pop     de
 316++CBBC C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 317++CBBD
 318++CBBD
 319++CBBD              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 320++CBBD              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 321++CBBD              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 322++CBBD              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 323++CBBD 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 324++CBBE 32 E6 9D                             ld      (varR),a
 325++CBC1 CD 2C CC                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 326++CBC4 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 327++CBC5 C5                                   push    bc
 328++CBC6 47                                   ld      b,a
 329++CBC7 3A 01 9E                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 330++CBCA FE 00                                cp      0
 331++CBCC 78                                   ld      a,b
 332++CBCD C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 333++CBCE 20 23                                jr      nz, LL121
 334++CBD0              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 335++CBD0 3A F1 C9     LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 336++CBD3 32 E5 9D                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 337++CBD6 CD 9A AE                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 338++CBD9 22 F6 C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 339++CBDC F1                                   pop     af
 340++CBDD ED 27 80                             test    $80
 341++CBE0 CA 1F CC                             jp      z,LL133
 342++CBE3 C9                                   ret
 343++CBE4              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 344++CBE4              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 345++CBE4              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 346++CBE4              ;
 347++CBE4              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 348++CBE4              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 349++CBE4              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 350++CBE4 CD 2C CC     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 351++CBE7 F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 352++CBE8 C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 353++CBE9 47                                   ld      b,a
 354++CBEA 3A 01 9E                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 355++CBED FE 00                                cp      0
 356++CBEF 78                                   ld      a,b
 357++CBF0 C1                                   pop     bc
 358++CBF1 20 DD                                jr      nz, LL122
 359++CBF3              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 360++CBF3 11 FE FF     LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 361++CBF6 2A E6 9D                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 362++CBF9 3A E5 9D                             ld      a,(varQ)
 363++CBFC 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 364++CBFD              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 364++CBFD CB 25       >			   sla l
 364++CBFF CB 14       >			   rl  h
 365++CC01 7C                                   ld      a,h
 366++CC02 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 367++CC04                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 367++CC04 B8          >                        cp      b
 367++CC05 DA 10 CC    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 368++CC08 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 369++CC09 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 370++CC0A 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 371++CC0B 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 372++CC0C DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 373++CC0E 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 374++CC0F 3F                                   ccf
 375++CC10              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 375++CC10 CB 13       >               rl  e
 375++CC12 CB 12       >               rl  d
 376++CC14 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 377++CC16 ED 53 F6 C9                          ld      (varYX),de
 378++CC1A F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 379++CC1B ED 27 80                             test    $80
 380++CC1E C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 381++CC1F 2A F6 C9     LL133:                  ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 382++CC22                                      NegHL
 382++CC22 AF          >                    xor a
 382++CC23 95          >                    sub l
 382++CC24 6F          >                    ld l,a
 382++CC25 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 382++CC26 94          >                    sub h
 382++CC27 67          >                    ld h,a
 383++CC28 22 F6 C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 384++CC2B C9           LL128:                  ret
 385++CC2C              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 386++CC2C              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 387++CC2C              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 388++CC2C              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 389++CC2C 3A F1 C9     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 390++CC2F 32 E5 9D                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;Set Q = XX12+2
 391++CC32 3A E7 9D                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 392++CC35 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af
 393++CC37 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 394++CC3A 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127
 395++CC3C 2A E6 9D                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; else SR = | SR|
 396++CC3F                                      NegHL
 396++CC3F AF          >                    xor a
 396++CC40 95          >                    sub l
 396++CC41 6F          >                    ld l,a
 396++CC42 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 396++CC43 94          >                    sub h
 396++CC44 67          >                    ld h,a
 397++CC45 22 E6 9D                             ld      (varRS),hl
 398++CC48 21 F2 C9     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign
 399++CC4B F1                                   pop     af
 400++CC4C AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 401++CC4D E1                                   pop     hl
 402++CC4E C9                                   ret
 403++CC4F
# file closed: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
 805+ CC4F              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 806+ CC4F                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CC4F              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CC4F              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CC4F              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CC4F              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CC4F              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CC4F              CopyRotmatToTransMat:                       ; Tested
   7++CC4F 21 15 C0     LL15_CopyRotMat:        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
   8++CC52
   9++CC52 11 49 C0                             ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  10++CC55                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  10++CC55 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CC57 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CC59 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CC5B ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CC5D ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CC5F ED A0       >                        ldi
  11++CC61 21 1B C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatRoofvX
  12++CC64 11 4F C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatRoofvX
  13++CC67                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  13++CC67 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CC69 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CC6B ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CC6D ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CC6F ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CC71 ED A0       >                        ldi
  14++CC73 21 21 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatNosevX
  15++CC76 11 55 C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatNosevX
  16++CC79                                      SixLDIInstrunctions

  16++CC7B ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CC7D ED A0       >                        ldi
  16++CC7F ED A0       >                        ldi

  16++CC83 ED A0       >                        ldi
  17++CC85 C9                                   ret
  18++CC86

  20++CC86 ~                                    ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX

  22++CC86 ~                                    SixLDIInstrunctions

 807+ CC86                                      include "./Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
   1++CC86              TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15:
   2++CC86 2A 94 C0             ld		hl,(UBnkXX12xLo)					; get X into HL
   3++CC89 7C           		ld		a,h			                        ; get XX12 Sign
   4++CC8A E6 80        		and		$80									; check sign bit on high byte
   5++CC8C 47           		ld		b,a									; and put it in of 12xlo in b
   6++CC8D                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
   7++CC8D 7C                   ld      a,h
   8++CC8E E6 7F                and     $7F
   9++CC90 67                   ld      h,a
  10++CC91                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  11++CC91 ED 5B 0C C0  		ld		de,(UBnKxlo)						;
  12++CC95 3A 0E C0     		ld		a,(UBnKxsgn)						; get Ship Pos (low,high,sign)
  13++CC98 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  14++CC9A 4F           		ld		c,a									; and put sign of unkxsgn c
  15++CC9B CD 81 AC     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC		; this will result in HL = result and A = sign
  16++CC9E B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H to give 15 bit signed (*NOT* 2's c)
  17++CC9F 67           		ld		h,a
  18++CCA0 22 8E C0     		ld		(UBnkXScaled),hl					; now write it out to XX15 X pos
  19++CCA3              ; ..................................
  20++CCA3 2A 96 C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12yLo)					; Repeat above for Y coordinate
  21++CCA6 7C           		ld		a,h
  22++CCA7 E6 80        		and		$80
  23++CCA9 47           		ld		b,a
  24++CCAA                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  25++CCAA 7C                   ld      a,h
  26++CCAB E6 7F                and     $7F
  27++CCAD 67                   ld      h,a
  28++CCAE                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  29++CCAE ED 5B 0F C0  		ld		de,(UBnKylo)
  30++CCB2 3A 11 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKysgn)
  31++CCB5 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  32++CCB7 4F           		ld		c,a
  33++CCB8 CD 81 AC     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  34++CCBB B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  35++CCBC 67           		ld		h,a
  36++CCBD 22 90 C0     		ld		(UBnkYScaled),hl
  37++CCC0              ; ..................................
  38++CCC0 2A 98 C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12zLo)					; and now repeat for Z cooord
  39++CCC3 7C           		ld		a,h
  40++CCC4 E6 80        		and		$80
  41++CCC6 47           		ld		b,a
  42++CCC7                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  43++CCC7 7C                   ld      a,h
  44++CCC8 E6 7F                and     $7F
  45++CCCA 67                   ld      h,a
  46++CCCB                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  47++CCCB ED 5B 12 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKzlo)
  48++CCCF 3A 14 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKzsgn)
  49++CCD2 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  50++CCD4 4F           		ld		c,a
  51++CCD5 CD 81 AC     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  52++CCD8 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  53++CCD9 67           		ld		h,a
  54++CCDA CB 7C        		bit		7,h                                 ; if sign if positive then we don't need to do the clamp so we ony jump
  55++CCDC 20 16        		jr		nz,ClampZto4                        ; result was negative so we need to clamp to 4
  56++CCDE E6 7F                and     $7F                                 ; a = value unsigned
  57++CCE0 20 06                jr      nz,NoClampZto4                      ; if high byte was 0 then we could need to clamp still by this stage its +v but and will set z flag if high byte is zero
  58++CCE2 7D                   ld      a,l                                 ; get low byte now
  59++CCE3              		JumpIfALTNusng 4,ClampZto4					; if its < 4 then fix at 4
  59++CCE3 FE 04       >                        cp      4
  59++CCE5 DA F4 CC    >                        jp		c, ClampZto4
  60++CCE8              NoClampZto4:
  61++CCE8 22 92 C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl					; hl = signed calculation and > 4
  62++CCEB 7D           		ld		a,l									; in addition write out the z cooord to UT for now for backwards compat (DEBUG TODO remove later)
  63++CCEC 32 01 9E             ld      (varT),a
  64++CCEF 7C           		ld		a,h
  65++CCF0 32 E4 9D             ld      (varU),a
  66++CCF3 C9           		ret
  67++CCF4              ClampZto4:											; This is where we limit 4 to a minimum of 4
  68++CCF4 21 04 00     		ld		hl,4
  69++CCF7 22 92 C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl; BODGE FOR NOW
  70++CCFA 7D           		ld		a,l
  71++CCFB 32 01 9E             ld      (varT),a                            ;                                                                           ;;;
  72++CCFE 7C           		ld		a,h
  73++CCFF 32 E4 9D             ld      (varU),a 						; compatibility for now
  74++CD02 C9           		ret
  75++CD03
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
 808+ CD03                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm
   1++CD03              ScaleNodeTo8Bit:								; TODO make signed
   2++CD03 ED 4B 92 C0  	ld			bc,(UBnkZScaled)
   3++CD07 2A 8E C0     	ld			hl,(UBnkXScaled)
   4++CD0A ED 5B 90 C0  	ld			de,(UBnkYScaled)
   5++CD0E              SetABSbc:
   6++CD0E 78           	ld			a,b
   7++CD0F DD 67        	ld			ixh,a
   8++CD11 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
   9++CD13 47           	ld			b,a									; bc = ABS bc
  10++CD14              SetABShl:
  11++CD14 7C           	ld			a,h
  12++CD15 DD 6F        	ld			ixl,a
  13++CD17 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  14++CD19 67           	ld			h,a									; hl = ABS hl
  15++CD1A              SetABSde:
  16++CD1A 7A           	ld			a,d
  17++CD1B FD 67        	ld			iyh,a
  18++CD1D E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  19++CD1F 57           	ld			d,a									; de = ABS de
  20++CD20              ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop:
  21++CD20 78               ld          a,b		                            ; U	\ z hi
  22++CD21 B4           	or			h                                   ; XX15+1	\ x hi
  23++CD22 B2           	or			d                                   ; XX15+4	\ y hi
  24++CD23 28 0F            jr          z,ScaleNodeDone                   ; if X, Y, Z = 0  exit loop down once hi U rolled to 0
  25++CD25                  ShiftHLRight1
  25++CD25 CB 3C       >			   srl h
  25++CD27 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
  26++CD29                  ShiftDERight1
  26++CD29 CB 3A       >			   srl d
  26++CD2B CB 1B       >			   rr  e
  27++CD2D              	ShiftBCRight1
  27++CD2D CB 38       >			   srl b
  27++CD2F CB 19       >			   rr  c
  28++CD31 C3 20 CD         jp          ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop
  29++CD34              ScaleNodeDone:										; now we have scaled values we have to deal with sign
  30++CD34 DD 7C        	ld			a,ixh								; get sign bit and or with b
  31++CD36 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  32++CD38 B0           	or			b
  33++CD39 47           	ld			b,a
  34++CD3A              SignforHL:
  35++CD3A DD 7D        	ld			a,ixl								; get sign bit and or with b
  36++CD3C E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  37++CD3E B4           	or			h
  38++CD3F 67           	ld			h,a
  39++CD40              SignforDE:
  40++CD40 FD 7C        	ld			a,iyh								; get sign bit and or with b
  41++CD42 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  42++CD44 B2           	or			d
  43++CD45 57           	ld			d,a
  44++CD46              SignsDoneSaveResult:
  45++CD46 ED 43 92 C0  	ld			(UBnkZScaled),bc
  46++CD4A 22 8E C0     	ld			(UBnkXScaled),hl
  47++CD4D ED 53 90 C0  	ld			(UBnkYScaled),de
  48++CD51 78           	ld			a,b
  49++CD52 32 E4 9D     	ld			(varU),a
  50++CD55 79           	ld			a,c
  51++CD56 32 01 9E     	ld			(varT),a
  52++CD59 C9           	ret
  53++CD5A
# file closed: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm

 823+ CD6B 3A 23 C3     SetAllFacesVisible:     ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+FaceCtX4Addr                                 ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 824+ CD6E CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 825+ CD70 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4  TODO add this into blueprint data for speed                                                           ;;; For loop = 15 to 0

 833+ CD7C C9                                   ret
 834+ CD7D              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 835+ CD7D 3A 23 C3     SetAllFacesHidden:      ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+ShipHullFacesCount                           ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 836+ CD80 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 837+ CD82 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4                                                                                  ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 838+ CD84 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 839+ CD85 06 10                                ld      b,16
 840+ CD87 21 BA C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 841+ CD8A 3E 00                                ld      a,$00
 842+ CD8C 77           SetAllFacesHiddenLoop:  ld      (hl),a
 843+ CD8D 23                                   inc     hl

 845+ CD90 C9                                   ret
 846+ CD91
 847+ CD91              ;;;;X = normal scale
 848+ CD91              ;;;;ZtempHi = zhi
 849+ CD91              ;;;;......................................................
 850+ CD91              ;;;; if ztemp hi <> 0                                   ::Scale Object Distance
 851+ CD91              ;;;;  Loop                                              ::LL90
 852+ CD91              ;;;;     inc X
 853+ CD91              ;;;;     divide X, Y & ZtempHiLo by 2
 854+ CD91              ;;;;  Until ZtempHi = 0
 855+ CD91              ;;;;......................................................
 856+ CD91              ;-LL21---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 857+ CD91                                      include "Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
   1++CD91              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
   2++CD91              Norm256mulAdivQ:
   3++CD91 47               ld      b,a
   4++CD92 0E 00            ld      c,0
   5++CD94 16 00            ld      d,0
   6++CD96 3A E5 9D         ld      a,(varQ)
   7++CD99 5F               ld      e,a
   8++CD9A              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
   9++CD9A              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
  10++CD9A              NormDIV16UNDOC:
  11++CD9A 21 00 00         ld      hl,0
  12++CD9D 78               ld      a,b
  13++CD9E 06 10            ld      b,16
  14++CDA0              NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP:
  15++CDA0 CB 31        	sll	    c		; unroll 16 times
  16++CDA2 17           	rla	    		; ...
  17++CDA3 ED 6A        	adc	    hl,hl		; ...
  18++CDA5 ED 52        	sbc	    hl,de		; ...
  19++CDA7 30 02        	jr	    nc,NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
  20++CDA9 19           	add	    hl,de		; ...
  21++CDAA 0D           	dec	    c		; ...
  22++CDAB              NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP:
  23++CDAB 10 F3            djnz    NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP
  24++CDAD 79               ld      a,c
  25++CDAE 32 E6 9D         ld      (varR),a
  26++CDB1 C9               ret
  27++CDB2
  28++CDB2              ; Tested OK
  29++CDB2              ;LL21
  30++CDB2              NormaliseTransMat:
  31++CDB2                      IFDEF LOGMATHS
  32++CDB2 21 5A C0                     ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1     ; initialise loop
  33++CDB5 06 09                        ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  34++CDB7                              MMUSelectMathsTables
  34++CDB7 ED 91 50 63 >                     nextreg MathsTablesMMU,    BankMathsTables
  35++CDBB 56           .LL21Loop:      ld      d,(hl)
  36++CDBC 2B                           dec     hl
  37++CDBD 5E                           ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  38++CDBE                              ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  38++CDBE CB 23       >			   sla e
  38++CDC0 CB 12       >			   rl  d
  39++CDC2 7A                           ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  40++CDC3 E5                           push	hl
  41++CDC4 C5                           push	bc
  42++CDC5 CD CB 00                     call    AEquAmul256Div197Log        ; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  43++CDC8                              ;ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  44++CDC8 C1                           pop		bc
  45++CDC9 E1                           pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  46++CDCA 77                           ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  47++CDCB 2B                           dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  48++CDCC 10 ED                        djnz    .LL21Loop                   ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  49++CDCE                              MMUSelectROM0
  49++CDCE ED 91 50 FF >                     nextreg EXSDOSMMU0,        BankROM
  50++CDD2 C9                           ret
  51++CDD3                      ELSE
  52++CDD3 ~                            ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1         ; initialise loop
  53++CDD3 ~                            ld      c,ConstNorm                 ; c = Q = norm = 197
  54++CDD3 ~                            ld      a,c
  55++CDD3 ~                            ld      (varQ),a                    ; set up varQ
  56++CDD3 ~                            ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  57++CDD3 ~            LL21Loop:       ld      d,(hl)
  58++CDD3 ~                            dec     hl
  59++CDD3 ~                            ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  60++CDD3 ~                            ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  61++CDD3 ~                            ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  62++CDD3 ~                            push	hl
  63++CDD3 ~                            push	bc
  64++CDD3 ~                            call    Norm256mulAdivQ
  65++CDD3 ~                            ;===call    RequAmul256divC				; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  66++CDD3 ~                            ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  67++CDD3 ~                            pop		bc
  68++CDD3 ~                            pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  69++CDD3 ~                            ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  70++CDD3 ~                            dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  71++CDD3 ~                            djnz    LL21Loop                    ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  72++CDD3 ~                            ret
  73++CDD3                      ENDIF
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm

 860+ CDD3              ; Now we have

   1++CDD3              ; TESTEDOK
   2++CDD3
   3++CDD3              ;ScaleOrientationXX16:                       ; DEBUG TODO will combine with inverse later
   4++CDD3              ;        ld      a,(XX17)
   5++CDD3              ;        ld      ixl,a
   6++CDD3              ;        ld      ixh,9
   7++CDD3              ;        ld      hl,UBnkTransInv0x
   8++CDD3              ;        ld      a,(hl)
   9++CDD3              ;ScaleNode:
  10++CDD3              ;        ld      b,ixl

  21++CDD3
  22++CDD3              InverseXX16:								; lead routine into .LL42	\ ->  &4B04 \ DO nodeX-Ycoords their comment  \  TrnspMat
  23++CDD3              ; we coudl combine this with move to transmat later as an optimisation
  24++CDD3              ; INPUT - All Scaled
  25++CDD3              ;  They transmat has already been put into side, roof nose order
  26++CDD3              ;  XX16   = |sidev_x| |sidev_y| |sidev_z|  1  0  3  2  5  4 note each bytepair is Scaled value in low and high byte just for sign
  27++CDD3              ;  XX16   = |roofv_x| |roofv_y| |roofv_z|  7  6  8  9 11 10
  28++CDD3              ;  XX16   = |nosev_x| |nosev_y| |nosev_z| 13 12 15 14 17 16
  29++CDD3              ; OUTPUT
  30++CDD3              ;  XX16(1 0)   ( 3 2) ( 5 4 ) =  sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x
  31++CDD3              ;  XX16(7 6)   ( 8 9) (11 10) =  sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y
  32++CDD3              ;  XX16(13 12) (15 14)(17 16) =  sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z
  33++CDD3              ; First all side values become compoment 0 of each vector
  34++CDD3 2A 49 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevX)     ;
  35++CDD6 ED 5B 4F C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvX)     ;
  36++CDDA ED 4B 55 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevX)     ;
  37++CDDE 22 61 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x0),hl     ;
  38++CDE1 ED 53 63 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x1),de     ;
  39++CDE5 ED 43 65 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x2),bc     ;
  40++CDE9 2A 4B C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevY)     ;
  41++CDEC ED 5B 51 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvY)     ;
  42++CDF0 ED 4B 57 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevY)     ;
  43++CDF4 22 69 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y0),hl     ;
  44++CDF7 ED 53 6B C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y1),de     ;
  45++CDFB ED 43 6D C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y2),bc     ;
  46++CDFF 2A 4D C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevZ)     ;
  47++CE02 ED 5B 53 C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvZ)     ;
  48++CE06 ED 4B 59 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevZ)     ;
  49++CE0A 22 71 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z0),hl     ;
  50++CE0D ED 53 73 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z1),de     ;
  51++CE11 ED 43 75 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z2),bc     ;
  52++CE15 C9                   ret
  53++CE16
  54++CE16
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
 867+ CE16              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 868+ CE16              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 869+ CE16              ;   XX12(1 0) = [x y z] . sidev  = (dot_sidev_sign dot_sidev_lo)  = dot_sidev
 870+ CE16              ;   XX12(3 2) = [x y z] . roofv  = (dot_roofv_sign dot_roofv_lo)  = dot_roofv
 871+ CE16              ;   XX12(5 4) = [x y z] . nosev  = (dot_nosev_sign dot_nosev_lo)  = dot_nosev
 872+ CE16              ; Returns
 873+ CE16              ;
 874+ CE16              ;   XX12(1 0)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the sidev (or _x)
 875+ CE16              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+1 and magnitude in XX12
 876+ CE16              ;
 877+ CE16              ;   XX12(3 2)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the roofv (or _y)
 878+ CE16              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+3 and magnitude in XX12+2
 879+ CE16              ;
 880+ CE16              ;   XX12(5 4)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the nosev (or _z)
 881+ CE16              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+5 and magnitude in XX12+4
 882+ CE16              XXCURRENTN0equN1byN2div256: MACRO param1, param2, param3
 883+ CE16 ~                                    ld      c,0
 884+ CE16 ~                                    ld      a,param3                      ;
 885+ CE16 ~                                    bit     7,a
 886+ CE16 ~                                    jr      z,.val2Pos
 887+ CE16 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 888+ CE16 ~                                    neg
 889+ CE16 ~                                    ld      c,$80
 890+ CE16 ~            .val2Pos:               ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 891+ CE16 ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 892+ CE16 ~                                    bit     7,a
 893+ CE16 ~                                    jr      z,.val1Pos
 894+ CE16 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 895+ CE16 ~                                    neg
 896+ CE16 ~                                    ld      b,a
 897+ CE16 ~                                    ld      a,c
 898+ CE16 ~                                    xor     $80
 899+ CE16 ~                                    ld      c,a
 900+ CE16 ~                                    ld      a,b
 901+ CE16 ~            .val1Pos:               ld      d,a
 902+ CE16 ~            ;AequAmulQdiv256:
 903+ CE16 ~                                    mul
 904+ CE16 ~                                    ld      a,c
 905+ CE16 ~                                    bit     7,a
 906+ CE16 ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 907+ CE16 ~                                    jr      z,.resultPos
 908+ CE16 ~                                    neg
 909+ CE16 ~            .resultPos:             ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 910+ CE16                                      ENDM
 911+ CE16
 912+ CE16
 913+ CE16               ; TESTEDOK
 914+ CE16              XX12DotOneRow:
 915+ CE16              XX12CalcX:              N0equN1byN2div256 varT, (hl), (UBnkXScaled)       ; T = (hl) * regXX15fx /256
 915+ CE16 3A 8E C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                        ;
 915+ CE19 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 915+ CE1A 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 915+ CE1B 57          >                        ld      d,a
 915+ CE1C ED 30       >                        mul
 915+ CE1E 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 915+ CE1F 32 01 9E    >                        ld      (varT),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 916+ CE22 23                                   inc     hl                                  ; move to sign byte
 917+ CE23              XX12CalcXSign:          AequN1xorN2 UBnkXScaledSign,(hl)             ;
 917+ CE23 3A 8F C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)
 917+ CE26 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 918+ CE27 32 E7 9D                             ld      (varS),a                            ; Set S to the sign of x_sign * sidev_x
 919+ CE2A 23                                   inc     hl
 920+ CE2B              XX12CalcY:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ, (hl),(UBnkYScaled)       ; Q = XX16 * XX15 /256 using varQ to hold regXX15fx
 920+ CE2B 3A 90 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                        ;
 920+ CE2E 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 920+ CE2F 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 920+ CE30 57          >                        ld      d,a
 920+ CE31 ED 30       >                        mul
 920+ CE33 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 920+ CE34 32 E5 9D    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 921+ CE37                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = T =  |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256
 921+ CE37 3A 01 9E    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 921+ CE3A 32 E6 9D    >                        ld       (varR),a
 922+ CE3D 23                                   inc     hl
 923+ CE3E                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkYScaledSign,(hl)             ; Set A to the sign of y_sign * sidev_y
 923+ CE3E 3A 91 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)
 923+ CE41 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 924+ CE42              ; (S)A = |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256  = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 925+ CE42 E5           STequSRplusAQ           push    hl
 926+ CE43 CD A8 B6                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 927+ CE46 E1                                   pop     hl
 928+ CE47 32 01 9E                             ld      (varT),a                            ; T = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 929+ CE4A 23                                   inc     hl
 930+ CE4B              XX12CalcZ:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ,(hl),(UBnkZScaled)       ; Q = |sidev_z| * z_lo / 256
 930+ CE4B 3A 92 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                        ;
 930+ CE4E 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 930+ CE4F 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 930+ CE50 57          >                        ld      d,a
 930+ CE51 ED 30       >                        mul
 930+ CE53 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 930+ CE54 32 E5 9D    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 931+ CE57                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 931+ CE57 3A 01 9E    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 931+ CE5A 32 E6 9D    >                        ld       (varR),a
 932+ CE5D 23                                   inc     hl
 933+ CE5E                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkZScaledSign,(hl)             ; A = sign of z_sign * sidev_z
 933+ CE5E 3A 93 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
 933+ CE61 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 934+ CE62              ; (S)A= |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo + |sidev_z| * z_lo
 935+ CE62 CD A8 B6                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 936+ CE65              ; Now we exit with A = result S = Sign
 937+ CE65 C9                                   ret
 938+ CE66
 939+ CE66
 940+ CE66              ;-- LL51---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 941+ CE66              ;TESTED OK
 942+ CE66              XX12EquXX15DotProductXX16:
 943+ CE66              XX12EquScaleDotOrientation:                         ; .LL51 \ -> &4832 \ XX12=XX15.XX16  each vector is 16-bit x,y,z
 944+ CE66 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                                ; LDX, LDY 0
 945+ CE69 21 49 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatSidevX
 946+ CE6C CD 16 CE                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 947+ CE6F 32 94 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xLo),a
 948+ CE72 3A E7 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 949+ CE75 32 95 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xSign),a
 950+ CE78 21 4F C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatRoofvX
 951+ CE7B CD 16 CE                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 952+ CE7E 32 96 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12yLo),a
 953+ CE81 3A E7 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 954+ CE84 32 97 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12ySign),a
 955+ CE87 21 55 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevX
 956+ CE8A CD 16 CE                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 957+ CE8D 32 98 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zLo),a
 958+ CE90 3A E7 9D                             ld      a,(varS)
 959+ CE93 32 99 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zSign),a
 960+ CE96 C9                                   ret
 961+ CE97              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 962+ CE97                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm
   1++CE97              CopyXX12ScaledToXX18:
   2++CE97              CopyResultToDrawCam:
   3++CE97                      ldCopyByte XX12         ,XX18             ; XX12+0 => XX18+0  Set XX18(2 0) = dot_sidev
   3++CE97 3A 94 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12)
   3++CE9A 32 82 C0    >                        ld       (XX18),a
   4++CE9D                      ldCopyByte XX12+1       ,XX18+2           ; XX12+1 => XX18+2
   4++CE9D 3A 95 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+1)
   4++CEA0 32 84 C0    >                        ld       (XX18+2),a
   5++CEA3                      ldCopyByte XX12+2       ,XX18+3           ; XX12+2 => XX18+3  Set XX12+1 => XX18+2
   5++CEA3 3A 96 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+2)
   5++CEA6 32 85 C0    >                        ld       (XX18+3),a
   6++CEA9                      ldCopyByte XX12+3       ,XX18+5           ; XX12+3 => XX18+5
   6++CEA9 3A 97 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+3)
   6++CEAC 32 87 C0    >                        ld       (XX18+5),a
   7++CEAF                      ldCopyByte XX12+4       ,XX18+6           ; XX12+4 => XX18+6  Set XX18(8 6) = dot_nosev
   7++CEAF 3A 98 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+4)
   7++CEB2 32 88 C0    >                        ld       (XX18+6),a
   8++CEB5                      ldCopyByte XX12+5       ,XX18+8           ; XX12+5 => XX18+8
   8++CEB5 3A 99 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+5)
   8++CEB8 32 8A C0    >                        ld       (XX18+8),a
   9++CEBB C9                   ret
  10++CEBC

  45++CF8B              XX15EquXX15AddXX18:
  46++CF8B              LL94Z:
  47++CF8B 26 00                ld      h,0                                                     ;           AddZ = FaceData (XX12)z +  ShipPos (XX18)z
  48++CF8D 16 00                ld      d,0                                                     ;
  49++CF8F 3A 92 C0             ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                                         ;
  50++CF92 6F                   ld      l,a                                                     ;
  51++CF93 3A 93 C0             ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)                                     ;
  52++CF96 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  53++CF97 3A 88 C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0zLo)                                     ;
  54++CF9A 5F                   ld      e,a                                                     ;
  55++CF9B 3A 8A C0             ld      a,(UBnkDrawCam0zSgn)                                    ;
  56++CF9E 4F                   ld      c,a                                                     ;
  57++CF9F CD 81 AC             call    ADDHLDESignBC                                           ;
  58++CFA2 47                   ld      b,a                                                     ;
  59++CFA3 7C                   ld      a,h                                                     ;
  60++CFA4 78                   ld      a,b                                                     ;           else  Scaled (XX15) Z = AddZ
  61++CFA5 32 93 C0             ld      (UBnkZScaledSign),a                                     ;
  62++CFA8 7D                   ld      a,l                                                     ;
  63++CFA9 32 92 C0             ld      (UBnkZScaled),a                                         ;           endif
  64++CFAC              LL94X:

 966+ CFEF                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ToScaled.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ToScaled.asm
   1++CFEF              CopyXX12ToScaled:
   2++CFEF              CopyResultToScaled:
   3++CFEF                      ldCopyByte  XX12+0,UBnkXScaled      ; xnormal lo
   3++CFEF 3A 94 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+0)
   3++CFF2 32 8E C0    >                        ld       (UBnkXScaled),a
   4++CFF5                      ldCopyByte  XX12+2,UBnkYScaled      ; ynormal lo
   4++CFF5 3A 96 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+2)
   4++CFF8 32 90 C0    >                        ld       (UBnkYScaled),a
   5++CFFB                      ldCopyByte  XX12+4,UBnkZScaled      ; znormal lo and leaves a holding zscaled normal
   5++CFFB 3A 98 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+4)
   5++CFFE 32 92 C0    >                        ld       (UBnkZScaled),a
   6++D001 C9                   ret
   7++D002
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ToScaled.asm
 967+ D002              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 968+ D002                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/DotProductXX12XX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/DotProductXX12XX15.asm
   1++D002              ;;; Q = XX12 xLo ,A = XX15 xLo
   2++D002              ;;; T = A * Q/256 Usgined  (FMLTU)
   3++D002              ;;; S = XX12 XSign Xor XX15 XSign
   4++D002              ;;; Q = XX12 Ynormal Lo, A = XX15+2 (y lo)
   5++D002              ;;; Q = A * Q/256 Usigned (FMLTI)
   6++D002              ;;; R = T
   7++D002              ;;; A = XX12+3 (ySign) Xor XX15+3 (ySign)
   8++D002              ;;; T = BADD s(A) = R + Q(SA) (xdot + ydot)
   9++D002              ;;; Q = XX12+4 (znormal lo) A = XX15+4 z lo
  10++D002              ;;; Q = A * Q /256 usigned (zdot)
  11++D002              ;;; R = T
  12++D002              ;;; A - XX15+ 5 Zsign Xor XX12+5 Z Sign
  13++D002
  14++D002
  15++D002
  16++D002
  17++D002
  18++D002              MacroAequDxEdiv256usgn:	MACRO
  19++D002 ~            						mul
  20++D002 ~            						ld	a,d				; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
  21++D002              						ENDM
  22++D002              DotProductXX12XX15:
  23++D002 3A 94 C0             ld          a,(UBnkXX12xLo)         ; Use e as var Q for xnormal lo
  24++D005                      JumpIfAIsZero dotxskipzero
  24++D005 A7          >                        and     a   ; cp 0 - changed to and a for optimisation but affects other flags
  24++D006 CA 23 D0    >                        jp	    z, dotxskipzero
  25++D009 5F                   ld          e,a
  26++D00A 3A 8E C0             ld          a,(UBnkXScaled)         ; use d as XX12 world xform x, e = norm x
  27++D00D 57                   ld          d,a                     ; de = xx12 x signed
  28++D00E                      JumpIfAIsZero dotxskipzero
  28++D00E A7          >                        and     a   ; cp 0 - changed to and a for optimisation but affects other flags
  28++D00F CA 23 D0    >                        jp	    z, dotxskipzero
  29++D012 ED 30        		mul
  30++D014 42                   ld          b,d                     ; b = result
  31++D015 3A 95 C0             ld          a,(UBnkXX12xSign)
  32++D018 21 8F C0             ld          hl,UBnkXScaledSign
  33++D01B AE                   xor         (hl)
  34++D01C E6 80                and         $80                     ; so sign bit only
  35++D01E FD 67                ld          iyh ,a                   ; we actually need to preserve sign in iyh here
  36++D020 C3 27 D0             jp          dotmuly
  37++D023              dotxskipzero:
  38++D023 AF                   xor         a
  39++D024 47                   ld          b,a
  40++D025 FD 67                ld          iyh,a
  41++D027              dotmuly:
  42++D027              ; now we have b = XX12 x &d  norm x signed
  43++D027 3A 96 C0             ld          a,(UBnkXX12yLo)
  44++D02A                      JumpIfAIsZero dotyskipzero
  44++D02A A7          >                        and     a   ; cp 0 - changed to and a for optimisation but affects other flags
  44++D02B CA 4A D0    >                        jp	    z, dotyskipzero
  45++D02E 5F                   ld          e,a
  46++D02F 3A 90 C0             ld          a,(UBnkYScaled)         ; XX15+2
  47++D032                      JumpIfAIsZero dotyskipzero
  47++D032 A7          >                        and     a   ; cp 0 - changed to and a for optimisation but affects other flags
  47++D033 CA 4A D0    >                        jp	    z, dotyskipzero
  48++D036 57                   ld          d,a                     ; de = xx12 x signed
  49++D037 ED 30                mul
  50++D039 4A                   ld          c,d                     ; c = result
  51++D03A DD 69                ld          ixl,c
  52++D03C 3A 97 C0             ld          a,(UBnkXX12ySign)       ; A = ysg
  53++D03F 21 91 C0             ld          hl, UBnkYScaledSign     ; a= y sign XOR Y scaled sign
  54++D042 AE                   xor         (hl)                    ; XX15+3
  55++D043 E6 80                and         $80                     ; do b = x mul c = y mul, iyh = sign for b and a = sign for c
  56++D045 DD 67                ld          ixh,a
  57++D047 C3 4E D0             jp          dotaddxy
  58++D04A              dotyskipzero:
  59++D04A AF                   xor         a
  60++D04B 4F                   ld          c,a
  61++D04C DD 67                ld          ixh,a
  62++D04E              dotaddxy:
  63++D04E              ; Optimise later as this is 16 bit
  64++D04E 26 00                ld          h,0                     ;
  65++D050 68                   ld          l,b                     ; hl = xlo + x scaled
  66++D051 16 00                ld          d,0                     ;
  67++D053 59                   ld          e,c                     ; de = ylo + yscaled
  68++D054 FD 44                ld          b,iyh                   ; b = sign of xlo + xscaled
  69++D056 4F                   ld          c,a                     ; c = sign of ylo + yscaled
  70++D057 CD 81 AC             call ADDHLDESignBC                  ; so now hl = result so will push sign to h
  71++D05A 47                   ld          b,a                     ; b = resultant sign , hl = add so far
  72++D05B 3A 98 C0             ld          a,(UBnkXX12zLo)         ;
  73++D05E                      JumpIfAIsZero dotzskipzero
  73++D05E A7          >                        and     a   ; cp 0 - changed to and a for optimisation but affects other flags
  73++D05F CA 84 D0    >                        jp	    z, dotzskipzero
  74++D062 5F                   ld          e,a                     ;
  75++D063 3A 92 C0             ld          a,(UBnkZScaled)         ;
  76++D066                      JumpIfAIsZero dotzskipzero
  76++D066 A7          >                        and     a   ; cp 0 - changed to and a for optimisation but affects other flags
  76++D067 CA 84 D0    >                        jp	    z, dotzskipzero
  77++D06A 57                   ld          d,a
  78++D06B ED 30                mul
  79++D06D E5                   push        hl                      ; save prev result
  80++D06E 3A 93 C0             ld          a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
  81++D071 21 99 C0             ld          hl, UBnkXX12zSign       ; XX15+5
  82++D074 AE                   xor         (hl)                    ; hi sign
  83++D075 E6 80                and         $80                     ; a = sign of multiply
  84++D077 4F                   ld          c,a                     ; c = sign of z lo & z scaled
  85++D078 E1                   pop         hl
  86++D079 5A                   ld          e,d
  87++D07A 16 00                ld          d,0
  88++D07C CD 81 AC             call ADDHLDESignBC
  89++D07F 32 E7 9D             ld          (varS),a
  90++D082 7D                   ld          a,l
  91++D083 C9                   ret                                 ; returns with A = value, varS = sign
  92++D084              dotzskipzero:                               ; if we got here then z was zero so no component so just tidy up from last add
  93++D084 78                   ld          a,b
  94++D085 32 E7 9D             ld          (varS),a
  95++D088 7D                   ld          a,l
  96++D089 C9                   ret
  97++D08A              ;;;;       DotProductXX12XX15:
  98++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkXX12xLo)         ; Use e as var Q for xnormal lo
  99++D08A              ;;;;       ld          e,a
 100++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkXScaled)         ; use d as XX12 world xform x, e = norm x
 101++D08A              ;;;;       ld          d,a                     ; de = xx12 x signed
 102++D08A              ;;;;		; FMLTU	\ A=A*Q/256unsg using D as A and E as Q
 103++D08A              ;;;;		mul
 104++D08A              ;;;;       ld          b,d                     ; b as var T
 105++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkXX12xSign)
 106++D08A              ;;;;       ld          hl,UBnkXScaledSign
 107++D08A              ;;;;       xor         (hl)
 108++D08A              ;;;;       and         $80                     ; so sign bit only
 109++D08A              ;;;;       ld          (varS),a                ; we did use c as S \ S	\ x-sign, but we actually need it in varS for BADD
 110++D08A              ;;;; now we have b = XX12 x & norm x signed
 111++D08A              ;;;; by here B = xlo & xscaled C = result sign
 112++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkXX12yLo)
 113++D08A              ;;;;       ld          e,a
 114++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkYScaled)         ; XX15+2
 115++D08A              ;;;;		ld          d,a						; MISSED THIS EARLIER BUG FIX
 116++D08A              ;;;;       mul
 117++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,d
 118++D08A              ;;;;       ld          (varQ),a                ; Q = Y y-dot
 119++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,b                     ; get back T from above held in b
 120++D08A              ;;;;       ld          (varR),a                ; R= b \ T	\ x-dot
 121++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkXX12ySign)       ; A = ysg
 122++D08A              ;;;;       ld          hl, UBnkYScaledSign     ; a= y sign XOR Y scaled sign
 123++D08A              ;;;;       xor         (hl)                    ; XX15+3
 124++D08A              ;;;;       and         $80
 125++D08A              ;;;;       call        baddll38                ; LL38	\ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 126++D08A              ;;;;       ld          (varT),a                ; var T	\ xdot+ydot
 127++D08A              ;;;;       ld          a,(UBnkXX12zLo)         ; use d as  varQ        ; XX12+4	\ znormal lo to varQ
 128++D08A              ;;;;       ld          e,a                     ; use e as var Q
